intro: Roella, commonly known as the "blue bottle" or "blue mist shrub," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. Roella species typically have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing small, hard seeds. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with partial to full sunlight.
